captions.text: The best race of Top Gear Korea season.
The race about to start.
The Cobra is spinning it's propeller.
Oh wow, I feel more tension than on any other Top Gear episodes.
The Cobra is right next to me. In the car I can feel it. The car is shaking really hard.
Two of the most popular brands in America are about to race.
Two icons.
Corvette and Cobra.
Their race will start soon.
I will go to the start line. Itís time to start.
Ready.
Oh! The car is moving.
It seems like it's right above.
Go!
Cobra seemed to start slow...
Wow. The Cobra is following me really fast.
I am not sure where the Cobra is now.
Hairpin Corner!
I need to reduce my speed...
But itís same for Cobra. Right?
That Cobra is really fast!
Where is it?
OkayÖ calm downÖ.road is really slippery.
It's right with me.
More...
More...
I can see the finish line!
I can see the finish line... But I canít see it! (The Helicopter)
I finally beat the Cobra!
But... Right after that, something happened...
What should we do?
what should we do?
Nobody expects the crash. Are the pilots okay?
As you can see, we couldnít proceed the race anymore because of the crash. Thanks to God, unbelievably, bothpilots are fine.

title: *EXTENDED* Helicopter Crash Caught On Camera (subtitled) - Top Gear Korea - Top Gear

comments.author: lyndon hunter

comments.text:
It was insufficient altitude for the attempted maneuver. Ground effect bled 
some power and made the aircraft less responsive as he tried to pull out 
and there was not enough altitude margin to regain control.
comments.author: Stu Bur

comments.text:
+Wyatt Sinko Having not read the report and only glancing at the video I

comments.author: Lyle Faraday

comments.text:
+Lyle Faraday Eh, no. Retreating blade stall occurs at the high end of a 
helicopter's (speed) performance envelope, which he wasn't even 
approaching.  You can actually read the NTSB report, and the pilot said 
that the controls froze up. I don't know if that's true, either, but oh 
well. He was dealing with an underslung rotor system that may not have had 
the control authority and out-maneuvered his own capabilities. Not a bad 
guess on your part, though!
comments.author: Wyatt Sinko

comments.text:
Retreating blade stall. He probably had too much momentum bleed in a short 
amount of time.
